alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 06 at 3:59PM EST until January 06 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation. Total snow accumulations of up to 2 inches and ice accumulations of up to one quarter of an inch. Locally up to 5 inches of snow northwest of Winchester. * WHERE...In Virginia, Shenandoah, Frederick, Warren and Clarke Counties. In West Virginia, Jefferson County. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A mix of snow, sleet, and freezing rain will continue to overspread the area today. More snow, potentially briefly heavy, is most likely north of US Route 50.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
